location.name: e.g., The Dragon's Lair, Room 1A
location.description: A general overview of the room or area. This is the main "box text" that a Dungeon Master would read aloud to the players.
location.environment: Details about the sensory experience of the room: what it smells, sounds, and feels like. e.g., "The air is thick with the smell of sulfur," or "A constant dripping can be heard from the corner of the room."

entry.description: e.g., A large, iron-bound door on the north wall.
e.g., A hidden door behind a tapestry, requiring a successful perception check to find.

exit.description: e.g., A dark, narrow passage leading to the east.

object.name: Treasure Chest
object.description: A large, locked wooden chest bound in iron.
object.position: In the center of the room.

creature.name: Orc Guards
creature.description: Two large orcs stand guard near the treasure chest.
